title: Identity Expression of Refugees and Asylum Seekers: Exploring Informal Multicultural Education and Performative Ethnography

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A project-based course exploring refugee identity expression through arts, performance, and ethnographic perspectives linked to science curricula

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the identity formation process of refugees and asylum seekers using performative ethnographic methodologies.
Learners can design multimedia projects that visualize refugee identity expressions using digital tools.
Learners can evaluate the applicability of learner-educator co-creation models in informal multicultural educational settings.

resources: Case Studies on Scientific Research Related to Refugee Identity

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
